articles.title: Mysterious orange aurora seen in Canada puzzle scientists - India Today
articles.description: Auroras, commonly known as Northern Lights, are typically seen in shades of red, green, purple, and even pink, which are the result of excited oxygen and nitrogen atoms in Earth's atmosphere.
articles.content:
In a mysterious celestial spectacle, the skies over Canada were painted with an unusual orange hue due to an aurora, leaving experts puzzled. 
The phenomenon was captured by Harlan Thomas on October… [+2194 chars]
